intro: Trimezia marumbina, commonly known as the Marumbina lily, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with strap-like leaves that are dark green and narrow. Its flowers bloom in clusters, adding a dramatic visual appeal to gardens. Trimezia marumbina thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun.
